timeline.message: replace name to "name" in query statement
Merge branch 'influxdb' of https://github.com/dmsolr/skywalking into influxdb

timeline.bodyText: Are you sure about this? ES7 client needs recompiling.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.message: _name is keyword in influxdb, which means the table name.

timeline.author: wu-sheng
timeline.diffHunk:

+                                                          .getService(MetricsCreator.class);

timeline.bodyText:
final Stream<Metrics> metricsStream = metrics.stream().filter(m -> !context.containsKey(m));
I think this stream is better choice for metricsDAO#multiGet, WDYT?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: This could avoid duplicated for loop before and inside metricsDAO#multiGet
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Passing the stream as an argument is very dangerous. Because stream can be consumed only one time.
replies.author: dmsolr

timeline.bodyText: You added a Traffic interface, I thinks this part should be refactored by leveraging that interface?
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText:
For now, there is no chance to declare this. Model is not related to this. From the design perspective, there is no concept called metadata anymore.
Right now, there are several places in influxdb storage option having this kind of name based mechanism, sadly.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
You added a Traffic interface, I thinks this part should be refactored by leveraging that interface?

For now, there is no chance to declare this. Model is not related to this. From the design perspective, there is no concept called metadata anymore.
Right now, there are several places in influxdb storage option having this kind of name based mechanism, sadly.



  
    
      skywalking/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-influxdb-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/influxdb/base/MetricsDAO.java
    
    
        Lines 66 to 68
      in
      2d646ee
    
    
    
    

        
          
           if (metaInfo.isTrafficTable()) { 
        

        
          
               queryStr = metrics.stream() 
        

        
          
                                 .map(m -> (Traffic) m) 
        
    
  


If so, this part looks very strange, it casts the metrics as Traffic with a condition isTrafficTable(), seems to be fragile and error prone because isTrafficTable() has no guarantee that the metrics can be casted as Traffic.
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: In Model, getName represents the model name, not a field of model.
replies.author: dmsolr

timeline.bodyText: If you says this implementing Traffic#name, the name is exactly the id(as nodeType related to name logically). What is the point of doing this?
